Hi

3D CSS

Finding the right perspective

What

it is

CSS Transform functions

  • rotate()

  • scale()

  • skew()

  • translate()

CSS Rotation

div {
  transition: transform 1s ease-in-out;
}
div:hover {
  transform: rotate(45deg);
}

But it's all flat

3D Transforms

New transform functions

  • rotateX()

  • rotateY()

  • rotateZ()

  • rotate3d()

     

  • scaleX()

  • scaleY()

  • scaleZ()

  • scale3d()

  • translateX()

  • translateY()

  • translateZ()

  • translate3d()

     

  • perspective()

  • matrix3d()

GPU acceleration

3D transforms support

How

it works

Card-flip

div {
  transform: perspective(700px);
  transition: transform 1s ease-in-out;
}

div:hover {
  transform: perspective(700px) rotateY(180deg);
}

Transform-origin

div {
  transform: perspective(700px);
  transform-origin: 100% 0;
  transition: transform 1s ease-in-out;
}

div:hover {
  transform: perspective(700px) rotateY(180deg);
}

Creating a cube

<div class="cube">
  <div class="face" id="top"></div>
  <div class="face" id="front"></div>
  <div class="face" id="right"></div>
  <div class="face" id="left"></div>
  <div class="face" id="back"></div>
  <div class="face" id="bottom"></div>
</div>
.cube {
  transform-style: preserve-3d;
}
.cube div {
  position: absolute;
}

Rotate and translate

.cube div#front {
  transform: translateZ(50px);
}
.cube div#back {
  transform: translateZ(-50px);
}
.cube div#right {
  transform: rotateY(90deg) translateZ(50px);
}
.cube div#left {
  transform: rotateY(-90deg) translateZ(50px);
}
.cube div#top {
  transform: rotateX(90deg) translateZ(50px);
}
.cube div#bottom {
  transform: rotateX(-90deg) translateZ(50px);
}
  1. set 3D rendering context by setting: transform-style: preserve-3d (now intersection can take place)
  2. setting it to flat, smacks all 3D transforms of it's children flat
  3. That makes the transform just a painting effect without affecting the painting order
  4. Note that the order of the transforms matters, because of the rotateY() on the back-face it uses the same translateZ value as the front-face, though it transforms it in the opposite direction

Order does matter

div {
  transform: rotateY(90deg) translateZ(200px);
}

is not the same as

div {
  transform: translateZ(200px) rotateY(90deg) ;
}

Perspective

.scene .cube {
  transform: perspective(1000px);
}

Shared perspective

.scene {
  perspective: 1000px;
}

Perspective values

.scene {
  perspective: 700px;
}
.scene:hover {
  perspective: 250px;
}

Perspective origin

.scene {
  perspective-origin: 50% 25%;
}
.scene:hover {
  perspective-origin: 0 0;
}

Perspective vs TranlateZ

.scene {
  perspective: 700px;
}
.scene div {
  transform: translateZ(0);
}
.scene div.clicked {
  transform: translateZ(1000px);
}
  1. if there's no rotation applied and the translateZ is greater than the perspective...
  2. ...the object will be invisible because it's behind the viewer

Behind you!

.scene {
  perspective: 700px;
}
.scene div {
  transform: translateZ(0);
}
.scene div.clicked {
  transform: translateZ(1000px);
}

Backface-visibility

.scene .cube .face {
  backface-visibility: visible;
}
.scene:hover .cube .face {
  backface-visibility: hidden;
}

getComputedStyle()

div#foobar {
  width: 200px;
  height: 80px;
  transform: rotate(-3deg) scale(0.9);
  transform-origin: 0 0;
}
var elm = document.getElementById('foobar');

elm.getComputedStyle('transform');

// matrix(0.9, -0.05, -0.375, 1.375, 220, 20)

New coordinates

Matrix3d()

div#foobar {
  transform: matrix3d(0.97, -0.11, 0.18, 0, 0.06, 0.97, 0.22, 0, -0.20, -0.20, 0.95, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1);
}

Tip 5: Photon.js

Limitations

  • All faces are still flat
  • No proper lighting engine

Alternatives

WebGL

Create with Blender

Import with Three.js

Proper lighting

Flash

Upcoming standards

Markup based 3D

  • W3C Declarative 3D Community Group
  • X3D: XML based 3D graphics format
<dec3d width="400px" height="400px">
  <scene>
    <viewpointposition="0010"/>
    <shape>
      <appearance>
        <materialdiffuseColor="001"/>
      </appearance>
      <box DEF="box" size="111"/>
    </shape>
  </scene>
</dec3d>

CSS Custom Filters

Adobe CSS FilterLab: adobe.ly/PqozPh

Lessons

from the past

3D on the web isn't new

Don't get in the way

Avoid virtual reality gimmicks ... the goal of Web design is to be better than reality.

Jacob Nielsen

http://bit.ly/rveMQ
